content.rendered:
Photo by Christopher Michel

This week in Genesis, Matt Mullenweg chats to StudioPress.fm, a stunning new theme from WPStudio, and more GenesisFactory details revealed.

Let’s get to it!

Themes

A new week and another awesome new theme, this time from Frank over at WPStudio. It’s called Scope – and like all of Frank’s other themes – boasts a stunning design.

Say hello to Scope, a clean looking #GenesisWP blogging theme. #WordPress #wordpressthemes https://t.co/CKQzgCGtAW pic.twitter.com/OYQt1J0EkM

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) October 11, 2016

Can’t wait for the recently previewed new StudioPress theme, Infinity Pro…

Discussing in slack the upcoming StudioPress #genesiswp woo-ready theme… we’re waiting patiently

— Jo Waltham (@JoWaltham) October 14, 2016

…look out for it in late October / early November (h/t Jo Waltham).

@JoWaltham Late October/ early November.

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) October 14, 2016

Showcase

Shaan Nicol for barefoot-sports.com.sg

FlyingOrange with a new Genesis / WooCommerce site for directgovsource.com

New #WordPress website launched for https://t.co/QD0KI3mvcX #MobileFriendly design using #WooCommerce features/plugins #webdesign #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/6TWoMgAIKH

— Flying Orange (@flyingorange) October 14, 2016

Michael Atkins for rosstribe.co.uk

Just launched https://t.co/ivKwVOoiIE for a talented portrait artist now taking commissions for delivery before xmas #genesiswp #WordPress

— Michael Atkins (@cubecolour) October 11, 2016

Podcasts

WordPress co-founder Matt Mullenweg appears on StudioPress.fm this week discussing how (and why it’s OK) to make money with WordPress.

How (and Why It’s OK) to Make Money with WordPress, with @photomatt https://t.co/C7LeKT1ynS #genesiswp

— Tony D. Clark (@nestguy) October 12, 2016

Jackie D’Elia chats to ‘the Voice of WordPress’, Shawn Hesketh of WP101 on rethink.fm.

Episode 5: The Voice of WordPress https://t.co/20xRsvwFpY

— Rethink FM (@rethinkfm) October 13, 2016

Best of the rest

Tonya Mork put out a new landing page and roadmap for her GenesisFactory project.

I had a good chat with her about the project and it sounds really interesting.

Described as a ‘theme builder’, I’d definitely recommend checking out the site, if you’re curious.

Hey #GenesisWP, lookie what we are building for you @GenesisFactory https://t.co/ktDFOpOzEb

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) October 10, 2016

Jackie D’Elia on letting go of the desktop design mindset…

Designing a great user experience on any device is not simply a matter of resizing content. #UX https://t.co/TS4aslLg1d via @jdelia

— Jackie D'Elia (@jdelia) October 12, 2016

…plus she explores the challenges of moving a static site into WordPress Genesis in this portfolio example.

Moving a historical society static site into #WordPress https://t.co/XMmgUMheLQ #GenesisWP @Cms2Cms pic.twitter.com/93RvngKkCj

— Jackie D'Elia (@jdelia) October 11, 2016

(And if you don’t already follow Jackie, you really should).

Sridhar Katakam on applying a full content layout to WooCommerce pages in Genesis.

How to apply full content layout to WooCommerce pages in Genesis:https://t.co/TA6QjydaBG#GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) October 11, 2016

League WP on how to create a responsive feature comparison table in WordPress.

How to Create Responsive Feature Comparison Table in #GenesisWP #WordPress https://t.co/Dl2gG7T5pM

— League WP (@league_wp) October 11, 2016

And finally…

If you went to the Digital Commerce Summit this last week, I hope you had a blast.

Wrap up of the Digital Commerce Summit. #DCS2016 ⚡️https://t.co/KGRwGRb849

— Patrick Rauland (@BFTrick) October 15, 2016

Organised by StudioPress parent company Rainmaker Digital, it featured speakers including Rand Fishkin, Laura Roeder and Chris Ducker.

My presentation from today's #DCS2016 is online (in blog post form) here: https://t.co/jeOE8WK8rc pic.twitter.com/0P4eL8nImP

— Rand Fishkin (@randfish) October 13, 2016

(And if you missed out and still want to watch back, I believe you can still grab a virtual summit ticket).

Of course, huge congrats go to all the organisers…

To everyone who joined us for #DCS2016 and to all who followed along from home: THANK YOU. It was a great event because of you. ❤️

— Jessica Frick (@renewabelle) October 15, 2016

@renewabelle thanks to you & the team for your amazing hard work. Superstars! #DCS2016

— Joanna Penn (@thecreativepenn) October 15, 2016

…but especially to the Genesis community’s very own Brian Gardner on reaching a personal milestone during the event 🙂

Embarrassed but proud, just got into my first Uber ride ever all by myself. Look mom, I did it! #DCS2016

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) October 14, 2016

—

That’s all for this week, I’ll be back next Friday, Saturday, Sunday, sometime towards the end of next week with another update.

Till then, let’s keep Genesis awesome.

PS If you haven’t tried it already, check out Robin Cornett’s Scriptless Social Sharing plugin for your site or your next client project. It’s really nicely put together with just the right amount of options and additional configuations possible via some well thought out filters.

PPS If you enjoy these updates, I’d love it if you subscribed (below). Your support is greatly appreciated!
